column4: Is there a boot option similar to window's Safe Mode so that I can boot into an unbootable ubuntu and uninstall the problem application?
You can try single user mode (aka recovery mode) for a command line, or boot from the liveCD.

Synaptic might be a problem. Do you know how to use apt? You could mount it from the liveCD and chroot into it, but you would have problems running GUI applications from inside a chroot (not impossible, but definitely difficult)
and try starting X with the startx command.
basically, I had a bad install of beryl. I jsut want to uninstall it so that x-window will work properly. what method do you think would be the best?
Doesn't it give you a command line when you start ubuntu?
Then use apt to remove the problem package. apt-get remove <package>
apt-get remove worked. its gone, but xwindow still wont let me boot into a gui. the error I get is that there are "No Devices detected" in the xorg.conf file.
Do you have any backups in /etc/X11/?
not sure. I never made any. This is my first time using ubuntu, so i still dont know all of the good habits yet
It may have been made for you.
Move your current xorg.conf to something like xorg.conf.broken just in case, and them move your backup to xorg.conf
In case you don't know, the mv command cam be used to move or rename files. You'd want "sudo mv xorg.conf xorg.conf.broken" and then "sudo mv xorg.conf.bak xorg.conf"
cp instead of mv will copy.
Don't reboot. Run startx as regular user.
thanks so much for your help. It looks like I'm back in business :P
